messages.content: Hello! How can I assist you today?
how do i install a specific version of a go package

user: how do i install a specific version of a go package

You can install a specific version of a Go package using the `go` command. For example, to install version 1.2.3 of a package named `foo`, you would run:
```
go get github.com/user/foo@v1.2.3
```
This will install the v1.2.3 tag of the package from the specified Github repository.

Alternatively, you can specify an exact commit hash or branch name after the package path:
```
go get github.com/user/foo@commit_hash  
go get github.com/user/foo@branch_name
```
Hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
